MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Azure.Response<BinaryData> DocumentTranslate (string targetLanguage, Azure.AI.Translation.Document.DocumentTranslateContent documentTranslateContent, string sourceLanguage = default, string category = default, bool? allowFallback = default, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Azure.Response`1<class System.BinaryData> DocumentTranslate(string targetLanguage, class Azure.AI.Translation.Document.DocumentTranslateContent documentTranslateContent, string sourceLanguage, string category, valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> allowFallback, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Public Overridable Function DocumentTranslate (targetLanguage As String, documentTranslateContent As DocumentTranslateContent, Optional sourceLanguage As String = Nothing, Optional category As String = Nothing, Optional allowFallback As Nullable(Of Boolean) = Nothing, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Response(Of BinaryData)

abstract member DocumentTranslate : string * Azure.AI.Translation.Document.DocumentTranslateContent * string * string * Nullable<bool> * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<BinaryData> override this.DocumentTranslate : string * Azure.AI.Translation.Document.DocumentTranslateContent * string * string * Nullable<bool> * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<BinaryData>

Docs.param: Specifies the language of the output document. The target language must be one of the supported languages included in the translation scope. For example if you want to translate the document in German language, then use targetLanguage=de
Document Translate Request Content.

Specifies source language of the input document. If this parameter isn't specified, automatic language detection is applied to determine the source language. For example if the source document is written in English, then use sourceLanguage=en

A string specifying the category (domain) of the translation. This parameter is used to get translations from a customized system built with Custom Translator. Add the Category ID from your Custom Translator project details to this parameter to use your deployed customized system. Default value is: general.
Specifies that the service is allowed to fall back to a general system when a custom system doesn't exist. Possible values are: true (default) or false.
The cancellation token to use.
Docs.summary: Submit a single document translation request to the Document Translation service.
Docs.remarks: Use this API to submit a single translation request to the Document Translation Service.

Docs.param: Specifies the language of the output document. The target language must be one of the supported languages included in the translation scope. For example if you want to translate the document in German language, then use targetLanguage=de
The content to send as the body of the request.
Content Type as multipart/form-data. Allowed values: "multipart/form-data".

Specifies source language of the input document. If this parameter isn't specified, automatic language detection is applied to determine the source language. For example if the source document is written in English, then use sourceLanguage=en

A string specifying the category (domain) of the translation. This parameter is used to get translations from a customized system built with Custom Translator. Add the Category ID from your Custom Translator project details to this parameter to use your deployed customized system. Default value is: general.
Specifies that the service is allowed to fall back to a general system when a custom system doesn't exist. Possible values are: true (default) or false.
The request context, which can override default behaviors of the client pipeline on a per-call basis.
Docs.summary:
[Protocol Method] Submit a single document translation request to the Document Translation service
This protocol method allows explicit creation of the request and processing of the response for advanced scenarios.
Please try the simpler convenience overload with strongly typed models first.
Docs.returns: The response returned from the service.
Docs.exception: Service returned a non-success status code.
